title: The List Laboratory
story: Lists are one of Python's most powerful data structures! They're ordered collections that can hold multiple items. Think of a list as a container with numbered slots - you can access any item by its position (index).
instructions: Create a list called `fruits` containing "apple", "banana", and "cherry". Print the entire list, then print the first item (index 0), and finally print the length of the list using len().

tests.description: Should print list, first item, and length
tests.expectedBehavior: Output should show all required values

hints.text: Create a list with square brackets: my_list = [item1, item2, item3]
Access first item with [0]. Use len(list_name) to get the length
